What am I?
X

Great Horned Owl

This bird
  • is a very early nester, with egg laying and incubation underway well before the snow disappears
  • does not move far from the area in which it was born
What am I?
X

Blue Jay

This bird
  • belongs to a family of birds that has been found in fossils more than 25 million years old
  • sometimes applies ants to the undersides of its wings
What am I?
X

Red-winged-Blackbird

This bird
  • nests and breeds in wetlands across North America
  • is one of the first signs of spring in Canada
What am I?
X

Mallard

This bird
  • often waddles ashore from park lakes in cities to take food from the hands of visitors
  • may re-nest up to three or four times if nests are destroyed
What am I?
X

Roseate Tern

This bird
  • has deeply forked outer feathers that look like long streamers when the bird is in flight
  • has an elaborate courtship ritual in which the male, often carrying a fish, flies in high circles, closely followed by one or more females
What am I?
X

Peregrine Falcon

This bird
  • can dive at over 300 km per hour when attacking
  • is a species at risk in Canada
What am I?
X

Common Raven

This bird
  • is a large black songbird related to crows, jays, magpies and nutcrackers
  • is believed to be highly intelligent, being able to problem-solve efficiently using tools if necessary
What am I?
X

Killdeer

This bird
  • is both a strong flier and a swift runner
  • is useful to farmers because it has a large appetite for pests
What am I?
X

Loon

This bird
  • has many bones that are solid, rather than hollow like those of other birds, which aid its diving ability
  • can stay under water for almost a minute and dive to depths of 80 m
